column1: Homestead is a city within Miami-Dade County in the U.S. state of Florida
column2: between Biscayne National Park to the east and Everglades National Park to the west. Homestead is primarily a Miami suburb and a major agricultural area. It is a principal city of the Miami metropolitan area

column1: Homestead was incorporated in 1913 and is the second oldest city in Miami-Dade County next to the city of Miami. It is located approximately 35 miles (56 km) southwest of Miami
column2: and 25 miles (40 km) northwest of Key Largo. The name originates from when the Florida East Coast Railway extension to Key West was being built. The rail line was passing through an area opened up for homesteading
column3: and as the construction camp at the end of the line did not have a particular name
column4: construction materials and supplies for the workers were consigned to "Homestead Country"
column5: shortened to "Homestead" by the engineers who mapped the area.  The population was 60
column6: 512 at the 2010 census.  Homestead and neighboring South Miami-Dade County communities bore the brunt of Category 5 Hurricane Andrew on August 24

column1: The city of Homestead is located near the southern terminus of the Homestead Extension of Florida's Turnpike where it ends at its junction with U.S. 1.  Homestead is immediately north and east of Florida City
column2: and these two cities comprise the greater Homestead-Florida City area. Some of the notable unincorporated communities in the area are Redland
column3: Leisure City

column2: -80.468122).According to the United States Census Bureau
column3: the city has a total area of 14.4 square miles (37 km2).  14.3 square miles (37 km2) of it is land and 0.1 square miles (0.26 km2) of it (0.63%) is water.

column1: Homestead is a small-sized city. At its greatest north-south points – along SW 137th Avenue (Speedway Boulevard) – its city limits extend only 4 miles (6 km) – from SW 288th Street (Biscayne Drive) at the north end to (theoretical) SW 352nd Street at the south end. At its greatest east-west points – along SW 328th Street (North Canal Drive / Lucy Street) – its city limits extend 6 miles (10 km) – from (theoretical) SW 132nd Avenue at the east end to SW 192nd Avenue at the west end. U.S. 1 – known as Homestead Boulevard within the city limits – extends through a rather narrow northeast / southwest corridor of the city from SW 304th Street (Kings Highway) at the north end to SW 328th Street (Lucy Street) at the south end. It is at this point at the south end that Homestead and Florida City share a common border. (North of the north end at SW 304th Street is known as Unincorporated Miami-Dade County
column2: but it is locally known as the community of Leisure City).Major east-west streets within Homestead include SW 304th Street / NE & NW 15th Street (Kings Highway)
column3: SW 312th Street / NE & NW 8th Street (Campbell Drive)
column5: SW 328th Street / SE & SW 8th Street (North Canal Drive / Lucy Street)
column6: and SW 344th Street / SE 24th Street (Palm Drive).The original Homestead Air Force Base was once located several miles to the northeast of Homestead
column7: but due to annexation of formerly unincorporated land immediately to the east and northeast of the original city limits during the late-1990s the city and the far southwestern perimeter of the (now) Homestead Air Reserve Base share a common border for a small portion along SW 137th Avenue (Speedway Boulevard).

column1: A noteworthy tourist attraction within Leisure City is Coral Castle
column2: built by a jilted lover
column3: Edward Leedskalnin
column4: over the course of 28 years from 1923 to 1951.  The Fruit and Spice Park is also of interest.

column1: Homestead experiences a tropical savanna climate (Köppen climate classification Aw) that borders on a tropical monsoon climate (Am). Summers are hot and humid and high temperatures average between 88° and 92 °F (31° to 33 °C). Winters are warm and dry. The all-time record high temperature is 100 °F (38 °C)
column2: on 21 July 1942. Lows in summer average between 70° and 75 °F (21° to 24 °C)
column3: with low temperatures in all times of year averaging 5–15 degrees cooler than coastal Miami
column4: mainly because of its inland and rural location. In winter
column5: the area sees cold fronts bring cold weather for short periods from November to March. The lowest temperature ever recorded is 26 °F (-3 °C)
column7: which was recorded at Homestead Air Force Base
column8: some 10 miles east of the town. High temperatures in winter average between 68° and 80 °F (18° to 26 °C)
column9: and lows average between 57° and 64 °F (8° to 14 °C). Summer is the season when most of the rain occurs. Homestead has a wet season lasting from mid-May to early October. The dry season sees little if any rain
column10: with most of it coming with the passing of cold fronts. Snow flurries were reported to have been observed in the air at Homestead Air Force Base
column13: and marked the farthest south that snow flurries have ever been reported in the lower 48 United States.

column1: The city of Homestead is served by the Miami market for local radio and television. Homestead has its own newspaper
column2: the South Dade News Leader
column3: which has been serving the South Dade community since 1913. The News Leader is published on Fridays.

column1: Inside Homestead TV is a television program where viewers can find out about all the happenings in Homestead. Each month
column2: a news show is released offering Homestead residents updates on local events as well as other developments throughout the region. Also
column3: the program has in-depth interviews with the local Mayor & Council and City Staff

column1: These monthly news reports vary in topic every month. For instance
column2: the March 2015 video describes the new City Hall
column3: education and National Parks news.

column1: The Florida Department of Corrections operates the Dade Correctional Institution and the Homestead Correctional Institution in an unincorporated area near Homestead. The Dade CI was originally the Dade Correctional Institution Annex
column2: and the Homestead CI was originally the Dade Correctional Institution; the two received their current names on July 1
column3: 2003. In June 2018

column1: The principal roadways linking Homestead with the rest of Miami-Dade County are US 1
column2: the Florida Turnpike and State Road 997. The Florida Turnpike has three exits (6
column3: 5 and 2) as it runs south through eastern Homestead before eventually terminating at US 1 in Florida City. US 1 (Homestead Blvd.) runs northeast-to-southwest roughly through the middle of the city
column4: and is the only way to continue to the Florida Keys. State Road 997 (Krome Ave.) runs north-south through the western end of Homestead and through the historic downtown district.

column1: Miami-Dade Transit (MDT) runs several Metrobus routes connecting the Homestead/Florida City area to the rest of Miami-Dade County. Express routes run along the South Miami-Dade Busway
column2: connecting the area with Metrorail and the rest of the Metrobus network and on to Tri-Rail
column3: Amtrak and Miami International Airport. In addition
column4: MDT operates Dade-Monroe Express service from Florida City to the Upper Keys.

column1: The City of Homestead operates two local circulator Homestead Trolley lines. This free service operates daily and transits principal residential
column2: business and commercial areas
column3: as well as the historic downtown district and Miami-Dade College's Homestead Campus. The Trolley connects with Metrobus at the Busway and other Metrobus stops throughout the city.Starting in 2014 the Homestead Trolley began seasonal service to Everglades National Park and Biscayne National Park.  The free Homestead National Parks Trolley is offered by the City of Homestead in partnership with the National Park Service. Operating on weekends between January and April
column4: the service is the only public transportation option available to these two parks.The Homestead General Aviation Airport is located just northwest of the city's central business district.

column1: There are public marinas at Homestead Bayfront Park and Marina
column2: on Biscayne Bay east of the city and adjacent to Biscayne National Park's Convoy Point Visitor Center
column3: and at Black Point Park and Marina to the northeast.  Convoy Point also has a limited number of marina slips for day visitors to dock.
